comment: Awesome professor and a lovely woman! Her lectures are very informative, but very Spanish heavy. If youre struggling with the content or the workload, dont hesitate to ask for help! Shes very understanding. I had her spring semester during quarantine and she was by far the most on top of things out of all of my professors.

Mrs. Murphy is a kind and helpful professor. The work she gives isn't hard unless you purposely don't study the vocab and grammar needed for Spanish. Her accent is a little and it can be sometimes difficult to understand what she means, however, if you ask her to explain something she will do her best to do so. Definitely a great Spanish teacher.

I loved her. She's a native Spanish speaker so she knows what she's talking about. She's very lenient if she knows you care about learning the language and the class. She WANTS you to learn the language. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Very unorganized but she's really sweet and willing to help you outside of class. The homework is graded on three different platforms which is confusing. She speaks mostly Spanish in class. If you took Spanish 3 in high school this will be a breeze.

No clear planning or organization. Zero consistency in class structure or homework requirements. 4 different homework platforms. I already knew some Spanish, thought her rating wouldn't matter but I was so wrong. Horrible professor, this class isn't worth the time. You won't learn anything, and you'll be miserable doing it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She assigns homework on four different platforms - Connect, D2L, Quizlet, and physical papers she gives you (often, 2 - 3 of these are assigned on the same day). She lectures half in Spanish and half in English, even when nobody can understand the Spanish part of it. This class is a ridiculous amount of work for General Education.

Very nice person love her to death. First language is not english and she explains things in spanish and her accent is very heavy. She cares a lot and will help you if you need it. she requires a lot of homework and will not hesitate to give you a 0 if you dont print it and bring it in, easy A if you try and easy F if you dont try at all
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class has enough homework to really mess you up if youre taking a just a regular full schedule. If you are almost fluent in Spanish or if language is just youre thing. Shes great. If you are a regular college student and foreign language isnt your thing. Youre screwed

She was so difficult. She is very scatter-brained and she posts homework on multiple different platforms. She uses the book, the work-book, quizlet, Connect, and D2l. She messes up grades a lot. Participation is a must. There are multiple oral tests and lots of homework. I did more homework for this one class than 3 other classes combined.

Sra. Barahona-Murphy really likes students and wants to help them. A lot of material has to be covered in class and it won't work without the students doing their share of homework and reading ahead of class. She is very compassionate and gives chances for extra credit. Always tries to make even the last student understand.
She does challenge her students but is very willing to help in any way she can. She gives extra points for participation and extra credit assignments and really wants her students to succeed

I came into this class already having experience with the spanish language through school and my work place just expecting an easy A. I was WRONG. Get ready for homework from the textbook, workbook, quizlet and connect. WAY too much work for a beginners spanish class. Also, if you know any spanish/a little, don't take her. Horrible at explaning
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Murphy isn't too bad, but I don't think I would take her course again. There's a lot of group/partner work, and she makes due dates sooo soon from when she assigns things. Homework is online and always due at random times so watch out. She also doesn't really understand english that well so if you ask her a question she rarely answers.
